intro: Anneslea fragrans var. monticola, commonly known as the mountain anneslea, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Annonaceae family, which includes trees and shrubs characterized by their fragrant flowers and tropical habitats. The plant typically grows as a small tree or shrub, reaching heights of up to 5 meters, with smooth, greyish bark and compound leaves. Its flowers are unisexual, with separate male and female flowers on the same plant, and are known for their strong, sweet fragrance. The fruit is a spherical berry that turns from green to yellowish when mature, containing a single large seed.
